speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}    **THE RING** _Scene 1 - A Jewelry Store  Fade in.  Niles, Frasier and Martin enter the store._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, are you sure you want to do this without Daphne?  You know, when Lilith and I got engaged, she insisted on being involved with the ring selection process.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Niles
text: I appreciate your concern, Frasier, but I want to surprise her.

speaker: Martin
text: [_pointing_] How 'bout this one?  It's nice and sparkly.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking_] That's an earring, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?  Oh, I guess I better put on my glasses.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, prepare to relinquish your breath.

speaker: Niles
text: Which one?

speaker: Frasier
text: That one right there.

speaker: Niles
text: Next to the gaudy one?

speaker: Niles
text: The GAUDY one?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, which one do you like?

speaker: Niles
text: I was thinking of something more along the lines of that one, with the feathered band.  What do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think it's a good thing I'm here to talk you out of it.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm think I'm starting to regret bringing you along at all.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think it's a...

speaker: Clerk
text: Gentlemen, gentlemen, I'm sure we can find something that will bring you both a lifetime of happiness.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughing_] Oh, no!  They're not a couple!  My son Niles is here to pick out an engagement ring for his girlfriend Daphne.  And Frasier, who's been married twice, just came along to help him.

speaker: Clerk
text: I'm very sorry, I'll come back when you've had more time to look around.

speaker: Niles
text: Where did that come from?

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean, REALLY!  To just assume something like that, out of the blue...

speaker: Both
text: Latent!

speaker: Martin
text: Well you gotta admit, it wasn't such a big leap, given the situation.

speaker: Frasier
text: And just what is that supposed to...?

speaker: Frasier
text: What bejeweled seraph has escaped her provenance now?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm gonna go see if there's a line at the Orange Julius.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, I have several candidates, Niles, but before you turn up your nose at this...

speaker: Niles
text: That's it, right there.  That's Daphne's ring.

speaker: Frasier
text: The very one I was going to show you.

speaker: Niles
text: Stylish...

speaker: Frasier
text: Classic...

speaker: Niles
text: Stunning... Daphne. [_to the clerk_] Excuse me?  I'd like to see that one, please.

speaker: Clerk
text: Excellent choice, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you know her ring size?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, even better, her ring finger is exactly the same size as mine.

speaker: Clerk
text: Well, perhaps you should try this on, then.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry, I'm a little nervous.  I think it just hit me what this all means.

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing, it's just my back.  It's been acting up a bit in the last week.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, here, do you want me to give you a hand up?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, here's the ring, I'll just stay down here for a moment. _He hands it over, and Niles clumsily tries to put it on as people stop and stare.  Martin comes back in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Does it fit?  Oh, here, let me help.  No, come on.  Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, it's perfect!  You know, I always dreamed this would happen!

speaker: Martin
text: No, wait!  They're not a couple! _The applause continues as Frasier and Niles, oblivious, excitedly show Martin the ring._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez. **THE WORDS**  _Scene 2 - Cafe Nervosa  Fade in.  Niles is sitting at a table, reading some papers and choking up.  He gets control of himself and takes a sip of coffee.  Roz comes in, and he breaks down again._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I uh...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, is that Daphne's proposal?

speaker: Niles
text: What?  No, I don't, what are you...

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier told me.

speaker: Niles
text: That gossiping ninny!

speaker: Roz
text: Don't worry, he swore me to secrecy.

speaker: Niles
text: I swore HIM to secrecy!

speaker: Roz
text: So how's it coming?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm afraid I poured so much emotion into this speech I don't know if I can say it all without crying.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's okay.  Women like a man who isn't afraid to shed a few tears.

speaker: Niles
text: Last time I got all the way through it, I got dehydrated.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, maybe if you cut it down a little bit, you could get through it before the waterworks start.  Let me take a look?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, what about this paragraph here?  I mean, aren't words like "hopeless" and "despairing" kind of a downer in a proposal?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well this is where I describe my life before I met her. See, and then comes the part where she comes along and the meter changes to a more sprightly iambic: "Now-my-life-has- meaning."  Things that never made sense before suddenly are clear.  It's all because of this... wonderful woman.

speaker: Roz
text: It's all right.  I'm sure there's other stuff we can cut.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  Okay, like here: I mean, now do you really have to compare her to three different roses?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, which one would you have me eliminate?  The one that represents her beauty or her passion or... [_breaking down again_] her sense of humor...

speaker: Roz
text: Niles, you're just making this too complicated.  I mean, all we really want is for a guy to get down on one knee and say, "I love you.  Will you be my... wife?" **THE WINE**  _Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier, Niles and Martin are sitting around the dining table, tasting several bottles of wine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent.  Nice bite, smooth oaky blend.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, lovely finish.  I think this is definitely a contender. How about you, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, this one dislodged that piece of pot roast that's been buggin' me since lunch.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry, Niles, I'm just not the right guy to help you pick a wine for your proposal dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Dad, this is an important night for me, and, and I want you to play an important part.

speaker: Martin
text: I guess it is an honor to be included.  Thanks. [_rising_] Well, time to cleanse my palate, I'm gonna get a beer.

speaker: Niles
text: [_leans forward_] Now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not yet.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, exactly how drunk does he have to get?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pouring more wine_] To agree to take Daphne's mother out while you propose to her?  DRUNK, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  Fill 'er up.  Go ahead.

speaker: Martin
text: [_offstage_] Whoopsy.

speaker: Niles
text: You're sure he hasn't had enough?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what was the name of that widow you dated several years ago?

speaker: Martin
text: You mean Claire Wojadubakowski?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not yet.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, my taste buds are all sudsy clean.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's dive right back in.  Bottom's up. _Niles and Frasier take sips from their glasses.  Martin drains his full glass in one breath._

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, I tell ya, I haven't had this much to drink since the night I proposed to your mother.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  That was quite a night, I was nervous as hell...

speaker: Frasier
text: I love this story.

speaker: Martin
text: And then she said "No."

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  I've never heard this version.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she wanted to get married, but she just wasn't ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what was it that finally convinced her to say "Yes"?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you don't want to know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, come on, Dad, what Marty Crane magic did you weave to get her to change her mind?

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, I didn't change her mind, Fras.  You did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Martin
text: I'll never forget the look on that minister's face when your mother waddled down the aisle of Saint Barthalelamew.  Did you hear what I said?  I said "Barthalamar..."

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, there's a question I've been meaning to ask you...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, how can you change the subject after this bombshell?

speaker: Frasier
text: You knew?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, remember that time I had the chicken pox?  Mom told me to cheer me up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, go ahead.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  So, uh, listen, Dad.  Daphne and I, of course, want to be alone on the big night.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs and nudges him_] Oh, yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: And I was wondering if perhaps you could take Daphne's mother out for the evening.

speaker: Martin
text: You want me to take out Daphne's mother?!  Is that what this has all been about?

speaker: Niles
text: No!  More wine?

speaker: Martin
text: I can't stand that woman!  But if it'll help you out, sure I'll do it.  I'll go out with her.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad, thank you!  I will never forget this.

speaker: Martin
text: Forget what?  Ha!  Just kiddin' ya.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Hello.  How was the movie?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Not bad, considering my daughter's famous sense of direction made us forty-five minutes late.  Then she got me popcorn without butter and kept shushing me, just because I can predict what people will say next in a movie. [_sweetly_] Hello, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, excuse me. _Martin rushes into the kitchen.  CUT TO: the kitchen as he comes in.  Frasier is waiting._

speaker: Martin
text: I need a beer!  Now, now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you know we were just talking about the fact that I was a, a guest at your wedding?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just the least bit startling and I have always respected you and Mother and the decisions that you made throughout your lifetime, but this information does beg one question.  Dad, am I...?

speaker: Martin
text: A year older?  No.  Your birthday's the same, we just faked our anniversary all these years.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_collapsing with relief_] Oh, thank heavens! _Martin pats him on the shoulder as Frasier lifts his glass. FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **THE DIVERSION**  Fade in.  Martin and Mrs. Moon are sitting in a booth near the window. _

speaker: Gertrude
text: You know, Marty, I'm not surprised you asked me out.

speaker: Martin
text: Um, you're not?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, don't be coy.  A romantic boat ride to a remote island. I know when a man's trying to seduce me.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, Mrs. Moon...

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, it was inevitable, really.  I mean, here we are, two comfortable old shoes, looking for new mates.

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, I'm not that comfortable.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, maybe you just need someone to break you in.

speaker: Suzy
text: Isn't that Marty Crane, from work?

speaker: Peg
text: Right.

speaker: Suzy
text: Didn't you two have a thing goin' on?

speaker: Peg
text: No, we just made out at the office party.

speaker: Suzy
text: Then what happened?  Blew you off?

speaker: Peg
text: Actually, I think he was kind of interested.  He slipped a Note in my lunch, he drove past my house, he called me a couple of times and hung up.

speaker: Suzy
text: And you didn't do anything.  What were you thinking?  He's cute.

speaker: Peg
text: He is cute, isn't he?

speaker: Gertrude
text: What a wonderful sunset.  I bet you ordered it just for me, didn't you, Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, the sun goes down almost every night.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, you!  Stop making me fall in love with you.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, you know, I think there's been a bit of a misunderstanding here.  I didn't mean this to be a DATE date, more of a friendship thing.  You know, I really enjoy your company...

speaker: Gertrude
text: No, no.  I should have known. [_getting up_] What could you possibly want with a dried-up old prune like me?

speaker: Martin
text: [_following her_] You're not a dried-up old...

speaker: Gertrude
text: Please, I don't want your pity.  I'll just stand at the bar and drink all night.  Even though my doctor told me one more episode could cost me me liver.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, now come on...

speaker: Gertrude
text: If you want to pretend not to know me, I'll understand completely.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, you've misunderstood what I said.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, then you don't think I'm unattractive?

speaker: Martin
text: Unattractive?  You said that, not me.

speaker: Suzy
text: It's not too late, go over there and say hello.

speaker: Peg
text: He's with somebody!  It'd be weird.

speaker: Suzy
text: You don't have to make a play for him, just say hello.  You Can tell by his reaction whether or not he's still interested.

speaker: Martin
text: Gertrude, this is wrong.  Your husband just left you, you're vulnerable.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I'm not vulnerable.  I'm ripe and receptive.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, I'll tell you the truth.  You know, I was shot, right?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes, in the hip.

speaker: Martin
text: Except that the damage wasn't confined to the hip.   There were fragments that traveled... south.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Ohhh.  You mean...?

speaker: Martin
text: Yep.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes, but you can still...

speaker: Martin
text: Nope.

speaker: Gertrude
text: But they have pills now...

speaker: Martin
text: Nope.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Acupuncture?

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh!  Don't remind me!

speaker: Martin
text: No, the sad fact is, it just doesn't work.

speaker: Martin
text: I have absolutely no sexual feeling in my groin area, period.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, Marty, that's terrible.  Oh, I am sorry I brought it up.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's all right, no harm done. [_N.B. This is the first time we learn Mrs. Moon's Christian name._]  **THE PROPOSAL**  _Scene 2 - Niles' Apartment at the Montana  Fade in.  Frasier is in the kitchen, hovering over the shoulder of Wolfgang Puck, who is cooking the proposal dinner._ [_N.B. Puck was also a guest voice in[[8.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_8/mary_christmas.html "Mary Christmas") "Mary Christmas."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, Mr. Puck? _Wolfgang turns with a frustrated look and slams his spatula down. Obviously this is not the first such interruption Frasier has made._

speaker: Wolfgang
text: Yes, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: I, I couldn't help noticing, the crab cakes are getting just a bit... brown.

speaker: Wolfgang
text: They're getting beautifully crunchy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Because when I said "brown" I actually meant more like "black"... like "burned."

speaker: Wolfgang
text: They're Cajun.

speaker: Niles
text: Is everything all right in here?

speaker: Wolfgang
text: With the food, no problem. [_motions at Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Everything's under control, Niles, we're all set.  You just relax, okay?

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe it, I've worked so hard to make everything perfect for Daphne and now the moment is... almost... [_sniffing_] do I smell burning crab?

speaker: Wolfgang
text: It's Cajun!

speaker: Niles
text: It's her!

speaker: Frasier
text: Go!  God speed! _Niles hurries out.  CUT TO: the living room as he crosses to the front door.  There are a number of people waiting on the stairs._

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone, everyone, places, places!

speaker: Niles
text: Coming, my sweet! _He gets to the door, but continues to stamp his feet until the others are out of sight.  Then he opens the door to reveal Daphne, looking quite haggard._

speaker: Niles
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't touch me, I have the flu.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you poor dear.  Here, here, here, come here.  Sit right down here until we're ready to eat.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't eat.  I need me mouth to breathe.  I hope you didn't go to too much trouble with dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no.  I uh...  Hey, you know what?  A good cup of tea and you'll be rallying in no time. [_rising_] You'll never guess what I have planned for tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: All I want to do is stuff Kleenex up me nose, collapse on the couch and pray for death.

speaker: Niles
text: Keep guessing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's all right.  You lie here.  I'll go heat up some soup in the kitchen. _He heads for the kitchen.  CUT TO: the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: Dinner's off.

speaker: Wolfgang
text: [_turning_] What did you say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Niles, even if the crab cakes are a total write-off, we can still salvage a meal...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  Daphne's sick.  Oh, oh, Wolfgang.  Could you open up a can of plain chicken broth and heat it up for me? _Wolfgang looks at him in disbelief, then turns back to the stove, shaking his head._

speaker: Frasier
text: You're just canceling everything?  The choir, the string quartet, the dry ice?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, all of it.  I want this proposal to be the greatest night of Daphne's life.  What's the point of doing it if she's too sick to enjoy it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but we spent weeks pulling all of this together.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we'll just get everybody back sometime when she's feeling better.

speaker: Wolfgang
text: [_muttering_] Not everybody.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, listen.  I'll take Daphne into the guest room to lie down so you can get everyone out of here. Just be quiet, I don't want to spoil the surprise for next time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Rest assured, she won't suspect a thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_from the other room_] Niles?  I think there's a bird loose in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_guiltily_] I thought doves might be a nice addition. _Niles rushes out.  CUT TO: the living room as he comes in._

speaker: Daphne
text: It looked like a dove.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think your fever is causing you to hallucinate.

speaker: Niles
text: [_loudly_] Come along, let's take you to the guest room for a good lie down.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] Why are you yelling?

speaker: Niles
text: Because your ears are all stuffed up.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, they're not.

speaker: Niles
text: They're not?  Oh, maybe mine are.  Gee, I hope I'm not getting what you have. _After they exit, Frasier comes in from the kitchen.  He puts on his jacket, goes to the middle of the room and quietly claps his hands. People appear at the book landing, on the staircase, in the dining nook and two short people dressed as angels come from under the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Shh, shh, everyone!  Very quietly, I have an announcement to make.  I'm terribly sorry, but tonight's festivities have been indefinitely postponed, due to illness.

speaker: Angel
text: But we still get paid, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you still get paid.  Now, I need all of you to file, quickly and quietly, out the front door.  It is imperative that the young lady not know any of you were ever here.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_from off stage_] I'm telling you, that room has a draft.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hit the dirt!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s_] Why can't we sit in the living room and build a nice fire?

speaker: Niles
text: [_as they come in_] No, no, no, we can't go in the living room, it... has... that... [_looking around_] of course we can go in the living room and have a nice fire!  Come here and sit down. Do you want to borrow my pajamas? _She sits on the couch in front of the fireplace.  Throughout the following conversation, Frasier, who is crouched by the front door, directs the hidden people out with commando-style hand signals.  At each moment it looks like one of them might turn, Frasier gestures for everyone to freeze and swings the door shut, then opens it again and shoos them out._

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I feel silly in those, they're so big and baggy.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm the only one here who's gonna see you. _As Niles bends over and tries to ignite the fire, Frasier uses the clicking of the flint as cover, as he frantically gestures for the first group of people to crawl out the door.  As they do, another small group crawls from the dining area and hides behind the living room furniture._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, how about some tea?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not now. _He tries to ignite the fire again, and Frasier motions the next group out, while signaling to the group further back and pointing to the living room floor.  As the clicking stops, Frasier clenches his fist, meaning "stop."_

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I have some of those raspberry candies you like.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_pats the arm of the couch_] No, you stay right here next to me, Niles Crane. _As he sits, she lets out a big sneeze and Niles edges away from her.  Frasier motions the next group out, and the last group forward, pointing to his eyes to tell them to stay alert._

speaker: Niles
text: Get you a blanket, you'll catch a chill, darling.  Get you all comfy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sorry I ruined our evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you did nothing of the sort.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know what I did to deserve you.

speaker: Niles
text: You kidding?  I got the better end of this deal.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yeah, look at me: nose running, hair a mess, I must look a real fright. _She has another sneezing fit and Frasier hurries the last people out and closes the door.  He starts to crawl back towards the kitchen, then notices a server back in the dining nook.  He starts, then gestures for the man to come out.  The server shakes his head, wide-eyed.  Frasier gestures firmly, anger in his eyes, but the server shakes his head again.  Frasier gets down on his knees and elbows and crawls commando-style across the floor, like it's a fire zone._

speaker: Niles
text: You are simply the most adorable creature I have ever seen on this Earth.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sure.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I mean it.  From your beautiful toes all the way up to your crusty nose, there's not an inch of you that I don't adore. _Frasier stops at the staircase and points to the server, directing him out.  The server hunches over and rushes to the door._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, it's funny.  You could take a million years to plan the perfect evening, and you'd never come up with this. Daphne, I have to ask you a question.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hold on. _She takes a tissue and blows her nose, long and loud.  Frasier takes the opportunity to hide behind the staircase.  Daphne stops, takes a breath and blows some more._

speaker: Daphne
text: You were saying?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne Moon, will you, and your beautiful toes and your exquisite ankles and your precious knees, elbows and arms and fingers, shoulders... [_holds up the ring_] Will you marry me?

speaker: Daphne
text: ...Oh, Niles!  Of course I will. _She throws her arms around him.  Frasier holds his hand to his mouth as he chokes up.  At the landing at the top of the stairs, a "royal trumpeter" comes out, mistaking Daphne's acceptance for his cue.  As he lifts his horn to his lips, Frasier rushes up the stairs and takes him down with a flying tackle, preserving the silence.  Niles slips the ring on Daphne's finger.  FADE OUT._
